meanings.definition: To restore to a good condition through repair or renovation.
meanings.sent1: The old house was rehabbed with new paint and flooring.
meanings.sent2: She rehabbed the broken chair by fixing its legs.
meanings.sent3: The tired bicycle rehabbed itself magically overnight.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness rehabbed his broken spirit.
meanings.sent5: The rehabbed garden bloomed with colorful flowers.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she rehabbed her injured knee at the clinic.
meanings.sent2: He rehabbed his shoulder after the sports injury.
meanings.sent3: The cat rehabbed its nap schedule after a long day of playing.
meanings.sent4: The old car rehabbed its engine to run smoothly again.
meanings.sent5: The athlete rehabbed his muscles to get back in shape.
